label: A2B3_tP20_117_i_adgh-001
title: $\beta$-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$ ($D5_{12}$) Structure
comments:
Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$ can be found in at least six forms (Harwig, 1978; Locherer, 2011): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_mP20_14_2e_3e-003}{monoclinic $\alpha$-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$}, the ground state, stable up to 729$^\circ$, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_tP20_117_i_adgh-001}{tetragonal $\beta$-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$, $D5_{12}$}, a metastable state observed at 650$^\circ$C (this structure), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A13B20_cI66_197_af_2cf-001}{body-centered cubic $\gamma$-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$}, another metastable phase observed at 639$^\circ$C, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB8_cF36_225_a_f-001}{face-centered cubic $\delta$-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$}, the stable phase from 729$^\circ$ up to the melting point at 824$^\circ$C, \item a high-pressure \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hP20_159_bc_2c-001}{HP-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$}, and \item a second ``nonquenchable'' high-pressure structure, \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hP20_186_bc_2c-001}{HPC-Bi$_{2}$O$_{3}$}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Sill\'{e}n, 1937) presented this structure in the doubled-unit cell $C\overline{4}2b$ setting of space group \#117, and the ICSD entry is from that paper.  We follow (Harwig, 1978) and use the standard $P\overline{4}b2$ setting. We have shifted the origin so that the O-I atom is at the (2a) site.
